Module core.java.helper
Package com.pineframework.core.helper

Class ArrayUtils

java.lang.Object
com.pineframework.core.helper.ArrayUtils
public final class ArrayUtils extends Object
The ArrayUtils class provides utility functions for the arrays.
  • createArray(Class, int)
  • ofNullable(Object[])
  • random(Object[])
  • find(Object[], Predicate)
  • subtract(Object[], Object[], BiPredicate, Class)
  • intersection(Object[], Object[], BiPredicate, Class)
  • union(Object[], Object[])
  • concat(Object[], Object[])

  • Method Details

    • createArray

      public static <E> E[] createArray(Class<?> type, int size)
      The createArray method creates an empty array for any type (ArrayUtils).
      Type Parameters:
      E - type of array
      Parameters:
      type - type of array
      size - size of array
      Returns:
      ArrayUtils[]
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if type is null or size is less than zero

    • ofNullable

      public static <T> T[] ofNullable(T[] array)
      The ofNullable method checks if an array is null or not.

      If the array is null then it returns an empty array otherwise, returns the same array.

      This method is designed primarily for applying null functionality pattern.

      Type Parameters:
      T - type of array
      Parameters:
      array - array
      Returns:
      ArrayUtils[]

    • random

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> T random(T... vararg)
      The random method gets an element of an array randomly.
      Type Parameters:
      T - type of vararg
      Parameters:
      vararg - vararg
      Returns:
      ArrayUtils
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if vararg is null or empty

    • find

      public static <T> Optional<T> find(T[] array, Predicate<? super T> comparator)
      The find method finds an element in an array that is match with the comparator.

      It returns an Optional including the element and, it returns an empty Optional if there is no element.

      Type Parameters:
      T - type of array
      Parameters:
      array - array
      comparator - Predicate
      Returns:
      Optional
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null

    • subtract

      public static <T, E> T[] subtract(T[] array1, E[] array2, BiPredicate<T,E> comparator, Class<?> type)
      The subtract method performs subtract operation between two arrays based on a comparison function.

      All objects are included in array1 but are not included in array2.

      Type Parameters:
      T - type of 1st array
      E - type of 2nd array
      Parameters:
      array1 - 1st array
      array2 - 2nd array
      comparator - BiPredicate
      type - class object of ArrayUtils
      Returns:
      ArrayUtils[]
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null

    • intersection

      public static <T, E> T[] intersection(T[] array1, E[] array2, BiPredicate<T,E> comparator, Class<?> type)
      The intersection method performs intersection operation between two arrays based on comparison function then it returns common elements.
      Type Parameters:
      T - type of 1st array
      E - type of 2nd array
      Parameters:
      array1 - 1st array
      array2 - 2nd array
      comparator - BiPredicate
      Returns:
      ArrayUtils[]
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null

    • union

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> T[] union(T[] array, T... vararg)
      The union method performs union operation on two arrays and, it returns a new array including the elements of two arrays and removes the repetitive elements.
      Type Parameters:
      T - type of array
      Parameters:
      array - array
      vararg - vararg
      Returns:
      ArrayUtils[]
      Throws:

      The concat method joins an array and a vararg together.
